website_summaries.verdict: This keyboard will work with any tablet you have, but battery life is a little shorter than other brands.
pros: Works with iOS, Android, Mac, and Windows
The layout makes it easy to type
cons: Some buyers say this keyboard goes into sleep mode too quickly
Also it runs on AAA batteries that need to be replaced at least every three months

customer_reviews.title: Great "replacement" for Macbook Pro keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe this will save some time for someone in my situation. My Macbook Pro started having some issues with a few keys (coffee spillage) and I needed a temporary keyboard before I replace the native one. I placed my first order for the Amazon Basic keyboard, which turned out to be too small (black on the pics) This one (white on the pics) is pretty much identical to the native Macbook Pro in terms of key sizes, spacing and layout. The keys are slightly "higher" than the Macbook's. Paired easily and seems to be working great. Internal battery with USB charging is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Blurrio Com

customer_reviews.title: Been using this for ~3 weeks and absolutely love it. I opted out of an iPad case ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for ~3 weeks and absolutely love it. I opted out of an iPad case that had the keypad attached because of all the terrible reviews. I'm so glad I did. I bought an iPad as a replacement for my computer which was running extremely slow. I bought this keyboard and a stand and haven't looked back. Its sleek and modern looking. I only bring the keyboard when I need it to save on space. My partner has complained about the battery save mode which will disconnect when you don't use it for a while, he says the restart time is too long. But I haven't had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: tmks

customer_reviews.title: I like it. Here's why
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Here's why: - Works really well. - Much lighter, quieter, and thinner than the Logitech (430?), which makes typing in a classroom less awkward. - Shallower keys, so easier to type for me. I know folks out there are raving about mechanical keyboards. This is not, if you want the opposite of mechanical keyboards, like I do, then it is for you. - Connection isn't as perfect as the Logitech, and sometimes (very briefly) lags, but can be resolved by holding a key for a couple seconds. - Rechargeable, so I don't have to worry about destroying the earth.
customer_reviews.author: Angelyne

customer_reviews.title: ... the Amazon Basics keyboard and found it to have terrible lag. Then I tried the Logitech RF solar ...
customer_reviews.text: I first tried the Amazon Basics keyboard and found it to have terrible lag. Then I tried the Logitech RF solar keyboard, which didn't turn out to be much better. At this point I started thinking the problem was with the computer, but I thought I would try the Anker anyway. What can I say? It works great! No annoyances at all. Very reliable and nice to use. It was also cheaper than the other two keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Chevypower

customer_reviews.title: Essential product — please bring back
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best gadgets that I ever bought from Amazon! I usually manage e-mails from my desktop and I’m not good at typing on a small screen. With the C19 situation, I’m doing a lot more work on my iPhone and couldn’t live without this keyboard. The Bluetooth pairing isn’t too bad (and you can find prompts online) and once set up seems to remember itself nicely. The charge lasts days and it’s very good about putting itself to sleep after half an hour. The keys have a nice near-click feel and I can type fast on this.
customer_reviews.author: David Robinson

customer_reviews.title: SO AGGRAVATING!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this keyboard. It's a great size and seemed to be everything I could hope. HOWEVER, this keyboard has major defects. One of the worst being the space bar, it usually doesn't work (unless you hit right in the center--which is stupid & slow) and yet sometimes creates double spaces? Mainly, no spacing in all my text so it's REALLY slowing me down (and I'm a grad student with homework so this is mortifying). Also, the caps button is off too. overall just jenky product, so disappointed. Such a struggle to use that it wastes time and creates frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Meesh

customer_reviews.title: Disconnections with Mac
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of every Anker product I've owned. This keyboard works great most of the time, however it does seem to randomly occasionally disconnect while using it with a Mac. Not just from inactivity either because it is happening while its in use.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Anker Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Before I comment on Anker's Excellent customer service, let me say I love my A7721 keyboard. Like every other Anker product I've purchased, it is well designed and top notch quality. Now for Anker Customer Service. I contacted Customer Service after having difficulty pairing my keyboard. After suggesting several things to try, Anker determined it was a hardware problem and shipped me a replacement which I received 2 days later. You couldn't ask for a more responsive solution. This isn't a one time incident. Each time I've contacted customer service, I've been impressed with how they handle things. Excellent. Other companies could learn what first class customer service looks like by emulating Anker.
customer_reviews.author: William Reinhart

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable keyboard for an iPad or other mobile device
customer_reviews.text: Great little Bluetooth keyboard. I use it with my iPad daily. I haven't had issues with the auto-sleep that other users mention- it takes several minutes at the very least for mine to 'go to sleep' and it wakes quickly. Very lightweight, easy to slip into a bag and bring along. The keys move well enough and don't stick, although the action is about what you'd expect for a portable keyboard. The function keys are really handy with iOS. Keyboard cases add bulk to the case, cramp the keyboard and they're much more expensive. I'd strongly recommend this as a solution for anybody looking to word process on a mobile device.
customer_reviews.author: Hazel

customer_reviews.title: 5 letters do not work!
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited about this keyboard, but I can't believe how nonfunctional it is. Right out of the bag it was easy to set up and pair with my device, looked great, BUT. SEVERAL letters do not work. At all! Typing A-Z: ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPSUVXZ Letters that are unresponsive: Q R T W Y Tried restarting, recharging, etc but nothing. VERY disappointed and will be returning right away for a different product.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Better than what I was using
customer_reviews.text: My Imac delivered with a magic wireless Apple Keyboard. I hated it. It was a definite step down from the previous Apple USB keyboard it replaced. While I am not the greatest typist, touch sensitivity was too light, some keys worked intermittently, and some caused unwanted repeats. This Acker keyboard unfortunately has many of the same flaws. But the touch response is immensely better and, at 1/4 the price of the Apple product, is a real bargain. We will see how it holds up over the long run. More accurately, the review should be closer to 4.5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence Schiffman

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I love Anker powerbanks, I had really good experience with those that I decided buy another kind of product such this one.. My keyboard worked perfectly fine for 8 months, sundendlly it started disconnected from my MacBook Pro 2017 every 3-7 minutes, even when it had full charge... it was really anoying... so I contacted customer services and they provided me a few instructions that fixed the problem for 2 weeks, but also on those 2 weeks they send me a replacement without cost. The new one feels more responsive and performs better than the old one. In other words, the product is okay, good price but the customer service is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for compact use. Helpful staff, too!
customer_reviews.text: My first crack at this review was a 3 star, because my first keyboard had a defect. Customer service contacted me right away, and stayed with me through about a year's worth of forgetting to respond to their emails, sending me a replacement, and checking up on how I was doing. The replacement keyboard works perfectly; It's lightweight, easy to use, quick to charge, slim, and comfortable. It's a well designed and well made compact keyboard. Yvonne, I'm still sorry that I'm so slow in getting back to you. Enjoy your summer! <3
customer_reviews.author: apfarr

customer_reviews.title: It's a keyboard. It's beautiful. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Small table? No problem. Big Table? All the more no problem. I love anker products so I was surprised to see these keyboards.. I came across the AAA battery operated one first and when I got it, I just had to buy this one. These are awesome keyboards. Basic but it is divine. Beautiful to look at and makes it easier to have a theme on your desk. I use this on a windows laptop. I don't like how I still can't switch the Fkeys as default but I use those for gaming anyways so it doesn't matter right now.
customer_reviews.author: Kinglouiexxx

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard but directions suk
customer_reviews.text: I am using on a macbook pro so not sure if directions pertain to PC, but to pair, directions state to simply turn on, and keyboard will automatically enter pairing mode. I spent 45 mins before I realized this wasn't going to happen. Went to youtube. Found video explaining that to pair, you need to simultaneously press function and bluetooth key to place in pairing mode. Did this and paired immediately.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after one year to date
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for about a year and it got the job done, last week it just stopped working. I tried pairing the bluetooth, unplugging and charging and nothing worked. To be honest I kept it plugged in most of the time even though it was wireless. In the beginning with was the type of keyboard layout I was looking for, the price and aesthetic was good. The keys are a bit loud but that was tolerable. It just stopped working and is no longer returnable. If you are thinking about purchasing...I would look for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Cayley

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely do not buy this for a windows machine. It just doesn't pair. Manufacturer's support is non-existent except "make sure it's charged" (duh) and to update your computers Bluetooth driver (it is). Other than that, genetic advice to "remove pairing record" to try again. (not even hours of Googling could give me that info). Just stay away from this because there are scores of manufacturers whose hardware works or they are able to support. Not Anker.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Key caps fall off and don’t register
customer_reviews.text: This device seems to be a lemon. Within a few days of receiving it, and with only light usage, the ENTER key popped off. I tried to snap it back on but it continued to come off. It also isn’t responsive - during usage there are sometimes delays after typing a key and it being sent to the computer. Sometimes the key press never registers. Overall it does not feel well built compared to other alternatives. The Anker brand led me to try this but unfortunately to low price means low quality in this case.
customer_reviews.author: R. Guest

customer_reviews.title: A slim light real keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It’s what you want for a mobile office work. It’s sturdy, lightweight and the battery holds its charge. I use it with both my iPhone and iPad; the only caveat is that because it is paired to both, it connects with the last device used. Power off that device to get a connect with the other. Once I figured that out, it’s not a problem. Also recommend the Cosmos Neoprene Wireless Keyboard Sleeve. Slim and light, it fits perfectly and keeps the keyboard safe in my tote. Cosmos Robin Egg Blue Color Neoprene Carrying Protection Sleeve Case Bag for T300 Ultra-Slim Mini Bluetooth 3.0 Wireless Keyboard Model 98ANSLM78-BTA and 98ANSLM78-WBTA
customer_reviews.author: pinktech

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It took about an hour to figure out how to get the keyboard to work. I had to disable the Bluetooth on my computer and then enabled it before the computer would recognize the keyboard. The keyboard works great except for the space bar. I will be typing away and realize thatseveralwords are run together, exactly what just happened as I typed this. I am leaving them for emphasis. On another point, I just read an article that talked aboutwireless technology being badfor us. Oh well, I guess something is going to get us. I am again leaving the run together words to show the example of the space bar doing itsthing.
customer_reviews.author: May Eve

customer_reviews.title: Have it for two months now
customer_reviews.text: Haven't needed to recharge it for two months (since initially unboxing) and syncs up with macbook pro bluetooth seamlessly. Unlike a jelly bean mouse that I got, which switches off randomly in the middle of my work session at least once, this Anker keyboard stays tethered until sleep mode kicks in, and once I wake it up it automatically tethers back to the computer. Great experience so far! Updated review: 6 months later - first time I've had to charge it in 6 months! The battery is great - and I use it a lot every day.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Tsang

customer_reviews.title: Good brand but not this particular keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard would have been my favorite keyboard on the go if it had a stable connection and a little more ergonomic for typing. The keys are okay though a little louder, the major issue was an unstable connection. It goes to sleep in no time and takes solid few seconds to re-establish the connection. I ended up returning the keyboard and settled with Logitech K400 with a dedicated unifying USB adapter.
customer_reviews.author: biomeddit

customer_reviews.title: Anker  is a great product
customer_reviews.text: I am not one to usually write a review. I bought a new iMac and hated the keyboard and so began an attempt to find one I liked. I am sitting at my computer and can count 4 that I have bought the last one being a Logitech 480. My expectations were low when I ordered the Anker keyboard. I was extremely impressed when it arrived. It is the same color as the Apple keyboard except for it was a little larger exactly what I wanted. A grand slam in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Statton

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard is great quality, and the battery life is unbeatable
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is great quality, and the battery life is unbeatable. However, I can only give it a 3 star review because after a while, I started to have difficult getting it to sync with my macbook pro. At first, it connected perfectly, and there were no problems. Over time, my computer had difficulty recognizing the keyboard. I tried deleting the recognition and reinstalling the keyboard with no success. When I tried to reconnect, you could clearly see the code trying to pop up, but it would disappear each time before I had to read it and type it in to pair. Overall, I'm guessing there are some compatibility issues with apple products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life!
customer_reviews.text: Battery life lasts a looonnnngggg time! I have had it for 3 years now and used it almost daily for hours on end for work. I didn't have to recharge it but today I did because I felt that after 3 years I should charge it. The reason for my 4 stars is that it takes nearly 10 seconds to respond if left alone for a short or long period of time. So I find myself banging on the keyboard hoping to wake it up faster. So the bluetooth functionality does have a slight lag. If you can live with that then this is your keyboard. It's also very lightweight, slim, and portable.
customer_reviews.author: Anh

customer_reviews.title: Defective. One of multiple Anker product issues.
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, There was a problem with charging the battery, and Bluetooth connectivity. When plugged into charger, a solid green light would be lit, which indicates fully charged, but when removed from charging cable, the keyboard would not power on ( no lights or response to key stroke). When plugged in, I tried to connect Bluetooth following the instructions, but attempts with my Windows PC, MacBook, and iPhone were all unsuccessful. Anker seems to be a popular brand but multiple products I’ve purchased by Anker have failed ( charging cables, USB wall chargers, this keyboard...). The wall charger even sparked, so that went into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Ilia "chocolate" Codre

customer_reviews.title: Pair with a MAC
customer_reviews.text: Just got this for my Mac. Followed the instructions for pairing, but could not get it to pair. Called Anker customer service (1-800-988-7973), and they solved the problem. After turning on the power on the keyboard, you must hold down Fn+Z together for a few seconds, then release them. This will allow the keyboard to enter pairing mode. They said they were going to correct the manual to reflect this, but have not yet done so. Would have given it 5 stars except for this problem.
customer_reviews.author: bobegnal

customer_reviews.title: Duplicates key presses
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard routinely doubles key presses, which makes it completely unreliable. The delay from key presses and actually appearing on the screen is about .5-1 seconds.... which is actually pretty significant.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Schlegel

customer_reviews.title: A Low Priced But Solid Keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I am very, very happy with this keyboard. I have Mac OS High Sierra and my other peripherals are Logitech. I recently had to change computer and moved my peripherals and began having compatibility problems. Nothing worked. My old keyboard was really old and kind of falling apart so I took a chance on this one. It's not overly loud, it sits nice and level, and it is easy to pair. As much as I like Logitech products I had to dump my keyboard and this one has filled those shoes admirably.
customer_reviews.author: Cipher Art

customer_reviews.title: PROBLEM PAIRING
customer_reviews.text: I find the keyboard itself is an answer to my problem with the keyboard on my MacBook Air. I prefer the touch on this keyboard and, since it doesn't cost that much, I am super-happy! I had a problem pairing because the wrong manual was in the box and online. Customer support was very pleasant and helpful and I was up and running in a couple of minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Sharahn

customer_reviews.title: Has a mind of its own
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is great on size, form, and battery life. It has a great layout that makes it an excellent candidate for use with Mac. Unfortunately, the bloody thing has a mind of its own – often when typing, it will completely skip letters or add multiples from a single keystroke. The word "dude" could end up looking like "due" or "duuude." "Exponentially" could look like "eponntially"...or, with autocorrect, might end up being "exposé." Either way, that totally defeats its purpose, and my rate of error and correction increases exponentially when using this keyboard versus the standard Apple Magic Keyboard. Incredibly frustrating, to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Mowery

customer_reviews.title: Can't use in Windows
customer_reviews.text: I have a MacBook Pro, and I frequently go in and out of Windows 10. When trying to connect to this keyboard, Windows asks for a PIN number -- I cannot type one on the Anker Keyboard and Windows does not offer a PIN for me to type on the Anker Keyboard. I try "0000" and "00000000" and "1234" etc and nothing works. It just always says "try connecting your device again". This keyboard is totally useless to me in Windows. I tried resetting the PRAM of my MacBook, restarting Windows, etc.
customer_reviews.author: kyle freed

customer_reviews.title: Great little keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I love this so much I bought a second so I have one at home and one at work. Some folks mentioned that it falls asleep too quickly - I don't find that to be the case. I use it for office work and note that every now and then I have to press a key twice because it's asleep but it's not at all bothersome. Many folks comment on how compact it is and I like the clean look it gives my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2 Daughters

customer_reviews.title: OK replacement keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review almost 3 years after purchasing. I got this as a cheap replacement. It disconnects as soon as you stop using it for a minute, I'm not a fan of having to wait for it to reconnect each time I want to go back to typing, but I dealt with it. Now one of my arrow keys stopped working, so I need to buy a new keyboard because I use them a lot. OK as a budget keyboard if you need something to tide you over until you can afford something better.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Not the perfect product but the best costume service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for my wireless setup the whole feeling is great. However the G and H keys stop working for some reason. HOWEVER, I am surprised by anker customer service. They are really kind and nice. Without further ado, they just send a replacement after check the picture of my keyboard. You won’t regret if you buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: Yizhen Shi

customer_reviews.title: Atypical keyboard layout and not responsive!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, only about half of the "F Shortcut Keys" worked when it arrived. So I sent it back for a refund. Secondly, the layout of the keyboard is atypical. The "Control Key" and "Function Key" are reversed! For anyone that does shortcut keys frequently, don't buy this keyboard. As an example, you will constantly be hitting "Function-S" instead of "Control-S" to save. The keys were not as responsive as I had hoped. I had to hit some keys about three times for them to work. Otherwise, the price was cheap, Bluetooth appeared to work fine and the keys were comfortable to type on. That's why they achieved two stars instead of one.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Proved unreliable for me
customer_reviews.text: Gave this a chance perhaps a little too long after having owned it a little over six months. Bluetooth connectivity was a fairly consistent issue with this keyboard and today, I was simply unable to connect it to my MacMini again. Charge was fine on it. Connected another Bluetooth keyboard I had, and it’s been working fine. The Anker keyboard is now somewhere in the back yard and not sure I’ll give the company a try again
customer_reviews.author: Warren G. Beatty

customer_reviews.title: Defective  BUT Anker has great customer service and warranty replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Owned for 6 months. Noticable delay between hitting a key and it responding on the screen... poor latency. Then at the 6 month mark started spontaneously typing "l".... uhgg BUT ANKER to the rescue. They contacted me because of my former one star review and help me trouble shoot. And offered a replacement as it was a warrantee covered... bottom line: A company that stands behind its products... Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Evolution Creation

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard, good touch to the keys.
customer_reviews.text: This keyword is very solid, with a nice touch to the keys. I was dismayed that several of the function keys didn't not work as expected with my iOS computer. When I contacted the Anker, my problem was addressed quickly and seriously. After it became clear that there was something wrong with the keyboard, and not the set up, I was offered a replacement keyboard, which arrived quickly and works beautifully. I couldn't be happier with my new keyboard, and Anker's service. In fact, I've never been treated so well by anyone's customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Luce Weil

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with my MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: It paired right up with my MacBook Pro. I still don't know how long the battery lasts but after a month I decided to plug it in and top it off. Like any new keyboards, it took a bit getting used to but feels good. I pulled out an old monitor, a bluetooth mouse and now with this keyboard use my Mac as a desktop. Since I do everything at my computer, including eating, I figured much easier to replace a $20 keyboard than trash my Mac. I haven't tried it with my iPad yet sure it'll work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: JOEY C.

customer_reviews.title: Not so great little keyboard for my iMac, after all!
customer_reviews.text: I had a bit of trouble linking this keyboard to my iMac, but after reviewing my install for Bluetooth on this machine, I got it linked up and working. Keys are responsive and much better than the generic keyboard I was using with a cord. It works similar to the Apple keyboard I used. I like it. I guess I will need to see how long the rechargeable battery lasts per charge to give this a fifth star. Time will tell. Thanks. Now my mouse and my keyboard are wireless! After only three days, this keyboard failed to connect 4 times. Trying to reset, worked sometimes. I give up. To me, this device is not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Clements

customer_reviews.title: So Far so good
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an ancient wireless mac keyboard with this much more economic version. I really like the recharge capabilities as my old keyboard ate through lots of batteries. Four star is only because I haven't used this keyboard but a couple of months. I will update this review once I see how well the batteries keep their charge and if after a year they continue to function properly. So far I would definitely recommend this keyboard as a replacement for the Mac wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Rad keyboard...when it used to work
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED 04.05.17 Anker sent a new replacement, no questions asked without needing to return the original keyboard to them. The new one works great. It's rare to find this kind of customer service these days, so based on the new working keyboard and their quick response, I'm giving them 5 stars. Loved this keyboard...when it used to work. It's got a great feel, perfect size, I like even more than Apple's keyboard, but it stopped working today. It started typing on its own, then disconnected, reconnected and now it's dead. It still has plenty of charge but no go. Otherwise I would have given it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: At about 1/5 the price of Apple's keyboard, this is just about the best deal you could ever hope for. Got it in the mail today, once it was charged I had it hooked up and working in about 10 seconds. Works just as advertised, keys feel pretty good and it's nice and compact. I'm currently using it with my iMac as a means of using the computer through a display in my other room. But it's so light and compact that it'll probably also see use with my iPad or even my iPhone since I don't have a laptop anymore. Couldn't be happier with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: JCN1218

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard in September 2019 and it's April 2020.....the keyboard has died. Will not work via bluetooth or when directly plugged in. It always went to sleep very quickly and would loose charge quickly - had to be re-charged daily. I was just too lazy and busy to return this thing. It's no wonder it's out of stock now - hopefully they've stopped selling it, as it'a piece of trash.
customer_reviews.author: E. Emmens

customer_reviews.title: tiny, but better than a glass keyboard
customer_reviews.text: paired easily to an iPhone, iPad, and laptop. Seems to work OK, but does, as others have mentioned, go to sleep pretty quickly. -- update. 2 months later it won't pair with any of my blue tooth devices. Doesn't even show up as a device when it's in pairing mode. Tried all the voodoo about forgetting it on the iDevice or resetting the iDevice. I want to do a warranty return, but I can't figure out how. Update: Anker saw my review and reached out via email. They are sending me a replacement keyboard. Even if it doesn't work, they deserve an a+ for service, so back to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Fouts

customer_reviews.title: poor connectivity and space bar doesn't work correctly
customer_reviews.text: It lags when typing and often when hitting the spacebar (or even some regular character keys on occasion) it will insert 2 keystrokes instead of one, even if they key is tapped very lightly. It most frequently occurs with the space bar.. As an example I left the typiing errors in this review. The material and build quality is fine but the fact that it can't type correctly is a deal breaker..
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: Nice touch for typing. Works perfectly. Saw a complaint that it goes to sleep too quickly. What, you can't just tap a key and wait a second? Talk about being spoiled. And remember, going to s;eep saves on the battery charge. I guess ya just can't please some folks. I have another iMac with the apple keyboard, which works great too ..... just as good as this one but this one cost a lot less!
customer_reviews.author: Gary T. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful substitute to a mac keyboard where your battery gets stuck and you have no way to remove it but buy a new Mac keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Every mac owner who has their battery stuck and no way to remove it as mac does nothing to the design to allow a user to remove a stuck battery should switch to this keyboard. It has rechargeable battery that charges from a normal mobile charger, lasts 6 months on a charge and is significantly cheaper then a mac keyboard (think why mac cannot change its design to an environmentally friendly design when others can do and at one third the price. Key travel and quality of finish is superb.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha T

customer_reviews.title: From AHHHHHHHHH! to AH!
customer_reviews.text: My initial one star review: 'One star is one too many. Disconnects and won't reconnect w/o turning it on and off 40,000 times. I haven't smashed it (I've been able to talk myself back off the ledge). I have a Mac...don't know if that's relevant. If you're looking for alternative uses for your baseball bat, BUY THIS KEYBOARD!' Fortunately, ANKER has GREAT customer service. Based on my recent experience, if you have any problems they're readily available and will go the extra mile to achieve customer satisfaction. My 3 stars might be five for you. Based on price, size, wireless connectivity, and customer service, it's worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: FYI

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard Great Customer Service Great Company
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is great, good battery life and great typing surface. Customer service is even better. I had one of these for a year and three of the keys quit working, they replaced it with almost no interaction with me. Basically I filled out the form, provided details and a photo of the device and they drop shipped a brand new one to me and I had it in 2 days. Never had an RMA process that was so smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Not what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is disappointing in that I have to really strike the space bar in order for it to register. I thought I'd type out a lengthy email using it and see if it would loosen up any and it just didn't give me the typing experience I was looking for. I hoped it would be much like the Apple Mac keyboard, but it really only compares to it in size. It did pair up to my iPad very easy, and worked well...I'm just not thrilled with its ease of keys. I was contacted by customer service and they did an excellent job with taking care of my issues and constantly following through.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OKAY but not really a Windows keyboard alternative.
customer_reviews.text: Three stars at Amazon = "it's ok" and that's the perfect review for this keyboard if you want a 'Windows 10' keyboard. The reason why it's only 'okay' is that the control/fn/windows/alt keys are not where they belong on a 'true' Windows keyboard. This keyboard is trying to be 'generic' for all platforms but I think it would have been smarter to release platform specific versions. You see I'm coming from the Mac world and have had to already re-learn such command buttons. To do so YET again is too much for me, sorry. It's otherwise a fun little keyboard. And I can attest to it being very clonish of an iMac keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: The Pool Man

customer_reviews.title: Junk.... close enough to make you think it will work... but pushed me over the edge.
customer_reviews.text: This is useless if you're used to an Apple wireless keyboard. Function keys do not work as they should, and setting things according to guidance from the internet didn't resolve things. Backspace and delete functionality seemed to alter unpredictably, I'd return it but I got so frustrated with it I literally broke the thing in two. This from a 64 year old software engineer / systems integrator that rarely loses it over simple hardware. Junk!
customer_reviews.author: C. Benton

customer_reviews.title: ... first it was worked really well and was the perfect solution as a recording secretary for city meetings
customer_reviews.text: At first it was worked really well and was the perfect solution as a recording secretary for city meetings. However, other the last couple of months, the keyboard's performance has been lacking. Now the cursor spontaneously moves to different spots in the paragraph and keys will get stuck making your notes look like thhhhhhhhhiiiiiiiiiiiiiiissssssssss. Sometimes it's usable, but often I have to switch to pen and paper after only 15 minutes of using the keyboard. Very annoying since the meetings average 2 hrs long.
customer_reviews.author: WrenCouture

customer_reviews.title: Probably fine for mobile devices
customer_reviews.text: Update: Customer service was extremely helpful and replaced my keyboard quickly and everything is running smoothly. Only one shortcut that doesn't work now and it is for kind of an obscure app. Everything else works great and it holds a charge instead of changing batteries constantly like my apple wireless keyboard. I guess you get what you pay for. It's ok, a little slower to connect each time than apple, more likely to give you typing errors as it misses a key every now and then, many of the keyboard shortcuts I use on my desktop don't work on this keyboard. Probably going to splurge on an apple one again. Probably fine for mobile devices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works nicely-- BUT ....
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the small size on my cluttered desk! Small/lightweight enough even to travel with. Once connection has been established, it seems to re-connect readily. BUT - the (battery-saving) auto shut-off is too short a cycle, in my view. Most often, it times out even while I'm only doing a web search. A less frequent - but much bigger -- issue is that if I walk away and my computer times out, too, I have to re-connect my old keyboard to enter my computer password. Once I'm back into computer, have to go back to settings to re-connect bluetooth/keyboard. So I really can't dispose of my clunky old keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: SF customer

customer_reviews.title: So it's not very good at quickly switching between devices
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, but one caveat is that you have to reset it or turn one of the Bluetooth device off bc it gets confused which device it's controlling. So it's not very good at quickly switching between devices. *Edit: After few months of average use, the space bar no longer functions. I've tried the recommended action for resetting connection and charging, but nothing works. Not a very reliable keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Great Customer Support!
customer_reviews.text: At first when I received this product, I was having some connective issues where the keyboard would disconnect every time I didn't use it within a couple of minutes (versus the 30 minute window they state). I reached out to Anker customer support and they were SO helpful in walking through the problem with me, confirming that my unit was defective, and they sent me a new replacement unit! Now using a functional keyboard, I overall really like this product! It's nice and light, has a sleek look, and types really well overall. I would definitely recommend especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Anker reached out to me and offered to send a replacement keyboard after reading my original review. They sent out the replacement at no charge to me and expressed it over. I've had the replacement keyboard for over a week and it's been working great. Their customer service throughout it all has been fantastic. I really appreciate them taking the initiative to resolve the problem. Original Review: Bought this keyboard for the office and at first it worked ok. Now, a few weeks in, 4-5 keys are slow to respond or get stuck. Wouldn’t recommend due to quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jane G.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid - 2 keyboards could barely make it through 1 warranty period.
customer_reviews.text: 2 of these (the original and the warranty replacement for that one) barely lasted 14 months. Which unfortunately is 2 months past the original warranty period and so Anker has chosen to not honor/issue further replacements. I’ve been a big Anker fan but no longer. I can buy cheaper gear for less than half Anker’s price, which puts me ahead without the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Mudd

customer_reviews.title: Build quality good, just hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this over Bluetooth with a MacBook Pro. The build quality of this is good, but a few things really, really bug me about this keyboard: 1) The constant connection being lost then reconnecting happens in spurts and fits. While it is only for a few seconds... it's still a pain. 2) You have to press the keys much harder than I'm used to, particularly for "c" and "m". I have to either bang the keyboard forcefully while typing to make sure the keys register, or I'm constantly on the lookout for typos and needing to go back and fix things all the time. I will probably try to find a used Mac keyboard instead now...
customer_reviews.author: E. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money but some key annoyances to note
customer_reviews.text: As a general keyboard, its fine. Definitely good foe what its worth. The main issues are with connectivity. I connected fine and it could type, but i noticed that it would miss a LOT of letters. Also there was a ton of lag between a key press and it showing up on my ipad. It was even worse on my android phone. I unpaired and repaired and it did fix the lag, but the keyboard does miss some letters still. This is the only reason i gave it a 4 rather than a 5. Another minor gripe is that i wished it was usb-c rather than micro usb but not something to lower the rating over.
customer_reviews.author: Cheezburgers

customer_reviews.title: The quality is perfect for its price
customer_reviews.text: The quality is perfect for its price. Actually, I don't see why I have to buy Apple Keyboard 2. The apple keyboard 2 is absolutely fantastic, its design, its quality is simply amazing; however, it costs 100 bucks. I would say it's not worth. Comparing with Apple keyboard 2, the Anker's quality, touch feeling, design are 8.5/10. But, its price is just 20% of Apple Keyboard 2. Therefore, Anker keyboard is very compatible and worth for every single dollar we paid for it. I definitely recommend it for any Apple's users.
customer_reviews.author: Truong Le

customer_reviews.title: OK, some keys are fidgety
customer_reviews.text: I am using this with a macbook pro. It is definitely a great keyboard for the price. The build quality is decent. The keys aren't as smooth to press down as I would like. The backspace button is a nuisance. If you hit it just a tad off-center to the right it stumbles and doesn't register. Probably won't use it as an everyday keyboard but will find use for it as a travel keyboard or use it with my raspberry pi.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Homar

customer_reviews.title: Broke on day 33
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfectly good keyboard, but the #2 key which is also the @ symbol doesn’t work and of course it’s 3 days after I could get a refund or a new keyboard. This is the second time this has happened with Bluetooth keyboards. I bought a nicer one this time in hopes that it wouldn’t break, but oh well. If I could get some help that would be great
customer_reviews.author: Matt Brecke

customer_reviews.title: helped my ergonomic needs
customer_reviews.text: I needed a compact keyboard that worked readily with a mac. This one does pretty darn well. My only complaint is really minor. The directions booklet is 3 1/2" square and parts of it are simply too tiny to read, even with a magnifying glass. Come on, Anker, you aren't saving THAT much money by making it that small!
customer_reviews.author: Mando Guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent BlueTooth keyboard for mobile devices
customer_reviews.text: It's the perfect companion to your tablet. It feels like a good, study keyboard, but not heavy. The keys feel solid and provide the right amount of resistance. There are 6 rubber strips on the bottom that keep it from sliding around. The control keys are labeled for either PC or Mac users. The on/off switch is right on the side, and easy to reset if it goes to sleep while you are in thought. Only thing I'd like to see as an option with this keyboard is a cover.
customer_reviews.author: Rick O'Shea

customer_reviews.title: Too many double letters
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. I needed a small keyboard and it fits that bill. Battery life is great and no connection issues but a major gripe is double key presses, which is an issue even with repeat key settings off on MacBook Pro. It’s very annoying that you get a lot of double letters typed when you don’t want them when typing quickly. Leads to lots of spelling corrections.
customer_reviews.author: Dex McLuskey

customer_reviews.title: Didn't automatically enter pairing mode
customer_reviews.text: Other than one setup problem, I'm really liking this keyboard. Feels similar enough to my MarBook Pro's keyboard, that the transition between devices isn't annoying. However, when I was first doing the setup, the instructions were quite insistent that it would automatically enter pairing mode after power up. It didn't, nor did the instructions say anything about alternative ways to get it to pairing mode. Considerable googling before I finally found a web page with the "Fn-z" backdoor to force pairing. I came really close to sending this back right out of the gate because of this though.
customer_reviews.author: emmaA

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard! Spend the extra $ for the rechargeable version.
customer_reviews.text: There are so many choices for keyboards in today's market that I didn't know what to purchase. This keyboard works perfectly with my MacBook Pro and my iPad. I was looking for a rechargeable Bluetooth key board that would be compatible with all of my devices and the specifications seemed to fit the bill. This keyboard has met and exceeded my expectations. I would spend the extra money to get the rechargeable version versus the replaceable battery option. All of the devices you will probably use this keyboard with are rechargeable so you might as well purchase an accessory to accompany it that is rechargeable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer Dave

customer_reviews.title: I love this lightweight compact keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this lightweight compact keyboard. I ordered it mainly for use with my iPad - I'm an old fashioned touch typist and trying to keyboard with my thumbs or on a pop-up online keyboard will never work for me. The Ankur keyboard, while compact, feels just like a standard keyboard to my fingers. And to a life-long touch typist, the key action is as important as piano key action is to a pianist. This little keyboard feels just right. The set-up/pairing was simple, the price was great. Works for me!
customer_reviews.author: LLDWest

customer_reviews.title: Best Magic Keyboard replacement
customer_reviews.text: It's been almost two months since I bought this keyboard. This keyboard is a great replacement to the magic Keyboard which I used for 6 years. It feels great to the touch and is very compact. In this two months have never had any connectivity issues (which I had every now and then with the magic keyboard). I have used it constantly for two months and I have not charge it since it arrived. In summary is a great keyboard at a not crazy price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard for the money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only been using the keyboard for a few days, but so far it is a great keyboard for the money. This means that if you are expecting this to be as good as a $100 Logitech keyboard you will be disappointed. It recharges via usb, has keyboard shortcuts at for volume, screen brightness, and media controls. All features you would normally find in a more expensive keyboard. But the materials feel a bit cheaper and some of the keys feel like they stick just ever so slightly. With all that said, for the price you can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: William H

customer_reviews.title: Space bar hits twice
customer_reviews.text: I've tried everything. Compressed air, reseting the device, etc. On any program I use this keyboard will sometimes make 2 spaces when I only hit the spacebar once. Very frustrating. Makes the keyboard unusable in my opinion. For an example this is a sentence where I didn't alter the amount of spaces after I finished typing. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: It does it
customer_reviews.text: Checks all the boxes and is affordable. It's pretty responsive and lets you type like a human being on something as small as a phone. It links up and wakes up quickly, usually in a second or two, but that can get annoying if you don't like the little beep-boop noise on your phone or tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Euthenasian

customer_reviews.title: It might be nice if there were feet that flipped up to angle ...
customer_reviews.text: This has come in very handy with typing on my tablet. I have a Samsung Tab S2 and have no problems with it connecting or using it in apps. It might be nice if there were feet that flipped up to angle it a little more, but it is still decently comfortable as it is. I don't use it a ton, but I do shut it off after I'm done using it and I haven't had to charge it again after the initial charge. Very pleased with the battery life.
customer_reviews.author: M2Woodcrafts

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this keyboard, in hopes that it would be easy to write and type on my tablet. I had actually read all of the reviews, and ignored all of the negative ones, because of the general rating. I got this, and I started loading it, and it connected to my main tablet, only for a brief minute. Then it disconnected, and I wasted my time for maybe 1 hour, trying to play around and connect with it. I couldn't although I have multiple mobile devices that I have tried this on. This didn't work, at least for me personally. I wouldn't recommend this, because of my malfunction of it. Go and buy a better quality of keyboard please.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelina Meler

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetically pleasing and functionality backs it up.
customer_reviews.text: Is an affordable keyboard that is functional and works great for the price. The only reason I did not give it five stars was because they did not include a USB cable as I have seen included in multiple YouTube reviews. I have my own so it’s not an issue but if I didn’t that would be a hassle to have to go out and buy a cable to operate this keyboard. Also the product did not come with any charge. I provided 2 photos for anyone interested in this product below.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible with my set up.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is well made, priced right and I wanted it to work. I tried over the period of 1 week reading instructions, watching videos, seeking advice from on line user groups but I couldn't get to get the keyboard to pair with my MAC running Sierra 10.1.1. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: ESBE

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a great replacement for the Apple wireless keyboard
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good (2 weeks). Seems to be a great alternative to the Apple wireless keyboard (which is incompatible with spilled coffee). The touch and feel are good and the case, although plastic, seems very solid. Indicates when it need recharging. Connected to Mac mini seamlessly. And it costs a lot less.
customer_reviews.author: SWE43

customer_reviews.title: works for a while then goes kaput!
customer_reviews.text: It worked GREAT for 4 months! Only had to charge it ONCE in that entire time and I spend a lot of time on my computer and using this keyboard. However, about a month ago, many of the keys started sticking or not working. No, I didn't spill anything on it. I don't drink or eat at my desk for those very reasons. I literally pulled every key off and cleaned the keyboard thoroughly. I put all the keys back on and again, 1 week later, the keys aren't sticking, they just aren't working. Cleaning a second time did nothing.... Very disappointed because this is a nice compact easy to use keyboard...
customer_reviews.author: Robin Nicole

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard is made very sturdy and it works well with my mac
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the original keyboard that came with my mac. The keyboard is made very sturdy and it works well with my mac. It's also supposed to work as a keyboard for iPads, but I haven't tried that feature yet.
customer_reviews.author: Clancey209

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Update 3/5/2016: After my previous review, Anker contacted me. After a bit of testing they decided to send me a replacement keyboard. The new unit seems to perform better than the previous, but in reality I had already replaced the keyboard with an Apple wired full size keyboard. I will use the Anker as a backup, but I plan the full size wired keyboard until it gives me problems. Upped the review to 4 stars based on excellent customer support. Orignal review: An OK keyboard, but when it goes to sleep its kind of slow to wake up and start sending key strokes.
customer_reviews.author: Rude Dog

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: very happy with the purchase. working great. update: works much better if you put the magnet on the phone case instead of placing it between the case and the phone. I use it with Blackberry Keyone(it is a heavy phone) and it fell a few times when the magnet was behind the case.
customer_reviews.author: Gurkan Aydin

customer_reviews.title: I like it especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like it especially for the price!!. My second Anker keyboard for this computer. First one, which I really like.... spilled a little liquid and some keys went out. It was the battery operated version of this. Wish this one came in silver or other color combos. Also, not tilted up enough for me. Added some little slide feet about 1/4" thick. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Betty Cross

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly long battery life
customer_reviews.text: I am really surprised at how long this keyboard's battery lasts. I have only charged it once in the few months I've had it and I use it daily. The packaging was sleek, and so is the design. There is a small delay when turning it on and I always forget and type a few words before it "wakes up" but that really isn't a big issue. I am glad that it auto-sleeps, otherwise it would probably be dead all of the time because I would forget to turn it off. It works great with my Macbook Pro laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Great little keyboard with a couple of hesitations
customer_reviews.text: On a Macbook Pro 1) Love the feel of the keys 2) When typing, once every half hour or so the mac says that the keyboard is disconnected and then it reconnects immediately. This doesn't affect anything but is a little annoying. 3) just note that you can't use control-option-command button combinations together for some reason
customer_reviews.author: Dan Hardy

customer_reviews.title: is a great keyboard. Now I picked this up for my ...
customer_reviews.text: This, my friends, is a great keyboard. Now I picked this up for my window tablet. The keyboard was designed as a MUCH cheaper alternative for mac computers like the mac mini, but it linked up pretty easily to the Dell Venue 11 Pro I used to own. Typing on it was a dream, with no lag and response and comfortable keys. I believe this is a model that Anker put out in 2015, and the improvements (I had the previous model) were remarkable. Did it disconnect ever so often from the windows tablet? Yes, but not to the point that it was annoying. For all those mac users, this is a great alternative.
customer_reviews.author: G. Eric Francis

customer_reviews.title: Superb Portable Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my wife so she can use her phone and text typing on this keyboard. She can use if for Facebook posts, too. This is like having a little laptop without paying for a laptop. She plans to also use the keyboard for her tablet. She and I tried it out and it works flawlessly. This is a nice size keyboard. Not too small and not too big. It is very lightweight and can be moved around very easily. Two thumbs up to Anker!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff J.

customer_reviews.title: Worth consideration
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old daughter loves using this with her iPad MINI and is learning to be more comfortable and proficient with her typing skills. While small for my larger hands, it works terrific for her and her mother as well. The tactile feel and sounds of the keys is as you would like for it to be, without being too much. The battery life has been impressive and seems to be as indicated, though time will tell. Overall, we are very pleased with the keyboard and would recommend it to anyone looking for a compact wireless keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t pair to all mac device
customer_reviews.text: The appearance is really nice but doesn’t pair to any of my stuff. I tried my phone, laptop and ipad as well. The Bluetooth doesn’t work. Do pissed off and disappointed expecting to use it today. Grrr!!! My other keyboard showing and my phone but this keyboard NO. Such a waste of time. After how many weeks the keyboard become useless. But i like the design so much.
customer_reviews.author: chichi

customer_reviews.title: More useless than a career politician.
customer_reviews.text: Can't get it to connect with a smart but I can get it to connect with our iPads. . . however, it will not function and instead simply shows up as a Bluetooth device. Changing the operating system to IOS has the same effect as yelling at your Congressman--zilch. But at $12 buck, it's not worth the hassle of boxing up and returning. Will instead take it out to the pistol range and find a more proper, appropriate use for it.
customer_reviews.author: jdkinman

customer_reviews.title: OK, Not Quite as Anticipated
customer_reviews.text: It's OK... if you want a very inexpensive Bluetooth keyboard to use with your iPad. The description of compatibility is misleading... doesn't work with any of the recent versions of the Apple OS for Mac. The feel of the keys is far better on Apple's own keyboards, but this one is OK for the price. My keyboard arrived with no manufacturer's box, no warranty or operating instructions, charging cord simply plugged into the keyboard. More like a casually repackaged open box product.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for the price and love the fact that it had rechargeable batteries!
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard for the price. Works perfectly with my mac book computer. Currently in medical school, so constantly studying on my computer. This wireless keyboard syncs perfectly and really haven't seen any delay when typing but then again I'm a fairly slow or basic typer. Also love the fact that the batteries are rechargeable considering the fact that my biggest problem with wireless keyboards so far is that the batteries always seems to drain super fast. So far I've only charged the batteries once with my laptop and have had no issues in the past month. Will update the post in a few months if any complications arise.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: High hopes...
customer_reviews.text: I own various anker products (soundbuds slim, soundcore sport & soundcore sport xl, 2 batteries), and this keyboard is the dunce of the group. After allowing the keyboard to charge thoroughly, it reponds with a delay and inaccurately. I mean, C'MON!!! I speak so highly of this company just to get screwed by the ONE item I purchased to help lessen the tension in my head/neck from typing. Psht. This is upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Lace A

customer_reviews.title: Love This
customer_reviews.text: This is the best Bluetooth keyboard that I have ever used. It doesn't last me 6 months unfortunately because I use it for 5 hours per day in veterinary school, but I still get about 3.5 months. would recommend this to anyone looking for an amazing keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Even better than previous version.
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed, works perfectly. I also purchased the previous version, which had a AAA battery and fold-out legs to create a slant. I like this version better because the flat bottom has 4 rubber pads that keep it from slipping around. Also, the lights are more intuitive as you turn on the power and the unit connects over Bluetooth. An unexpected benefit is that the media controls on the top row (play/pause, volume +/-, screen brighness, screen lock) all work out of the box with both IPad and Android tablets.
customer_reviews.author: foghorn

customer_reviews.title: Would not work on my iMac desktop
customer_reviews.text: Would not pair with my iMac. The Bluetooth recognized it but it asked me to type a code but wouldn’t recognize it when I tried. After repeated attempts countless tutorials and reading the vague guide in painful detail, no luck. It’s also important to reiterate this this is mini usb chargeable keyboard but doesn’t come with a mini USB charger - not a problem for me, but a key detail to be aware of before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard connects easily to my iPad Pro
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard connects easily to my iPad Pro, and it is a nice size for travel. I must have a hard touch because it will move two spaces when I hit the space bar or it duplicates letters. I'm working to give it a lighter touch, but if you have a heavy touch, stay away. Update: Best customer service ever! AnkerDirect read my review and contacted me saying that the keyboard was defective. Without charge and without me having to send back the defective keyboard, the company sent me a new one! The new one works perfectly. I couldn't be happier!!
customer_reviews.author: Nadine

product_meta.title: Anker Ultra Compact Slim Profile Wireless Bluetooth Keyboard for iOS, Android, Windows and Mac with Rechargeable 6-Month Battery (White)
product_meta.description:
Anker Ultra Compact Bluetooth Wireless Keyboard
A slim, compact keyboard for one or more of your devices.

Ultra Compact
Lightweight and slim, this wireless keyboard occupies only a fraction of your precious desk space, without any annoying cords. 

6-Month Battery Life
Use it for over half a year on just a single two and a half hour charge (based on two hours of non-stop use per day). 

Comfortable Keys
Matte finish low-profile keys ensure smooth and quiet typing. Your most-used shortcuts, multimedia and other operations start at the touch of a button.

Broad Compatibility
Whether iOS, Android, Mac OS or Windows, link it up with various Bluetooth devices, tablets, phones, laptops or desktop computers. 

System Requirements
iOS, Android 3.0 and above, Mac OS X 10.2.8 or above, Windows XP / Vista / 7 / 8/ 10. Note: Page up, Page down, Home and End keys may work differently in Windows.

World Famous Warranty
At Anker, we believe in our products. That's why we back them all with an 18-month warranty and provide friendly, easy-to-reach support.

Note:
After 30 minutes of inactivity the keyboard will automatically go into power savings mode. Simply press any key and wait 2-3 seconds to wake it up.
For Android 4.4 and 5.0.1 users: The Caps Lock indicator will NOT light, but will still function normally.
This keyboard is not compatible with Mac OS X El Capitan.
Only compatible with devices which use Bluetooth 3.0 or higher.
feature_bullets: Ultra Compact: Takes up only two thirds the space of a traditional keyboard (11.3 × 5.0 × 0.5in).
6-Month Battery Life: Rechargeable lithium battery with an industry-high capacity of 800mAh lasts for 6 months between charges (based on 2 hours non-stop use per day).
Comfortable & Intuitive: Low-profile, matte finish keys enhance your typing experience. Automatically connects to your last-connected device.
Broad Compatibility: Use with all four major operating systems (iOS, Android, Mac OS and Windows).
Package contents: Anker Ultra Compact Bluetooth Keyboard, 2.3ft Micro USB charging cable, welcome guide, our fan-favorite 18-month warranty.

specifications.Operating System: IOS, Android, Mac OS and Windows
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars2,150 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
